author: mikemaccana
body:
Heya! Using PSCore 6.1 preview 2, when cancel a command with Ctrl C, the following dialog pops up:

    Terminate batch job (Y/N)?

I understand why this exists, but I'd also like the option to disable it, so cancelling cancels immediately. [Judging by Stack Overflow, I'm not the only one](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39085380/how-can-i-suppress-terminate-batch-job-y-n-confirmation-in-powershell)

So a request: could we have an environment variable to control this?

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body: @mikemaccana Can you please provide repro steps? Thanks.

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: @mikemaccana: I've since posted [a new answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/50892407/45375) to your SO question; the short of it is: the behavior is built into `cmd.exe`, and there's nothing that PowerShell can do about it.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
Hi @BrucePay! Sure. Start any long running process from PSCore, eg, here I'm running gulp:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172594/41529774-1c0e4476-72e6-11e8-9a6d-47bfc9504c3a.png)

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
Following it up, it looks like [cmd .exe does actually implement this behaviour](https://itsme.home.xs4all.nl/projects/misc/patching-cmdexe.html) (which makes sense as I can't see `Terminate batch` anywhere in the powershell source with `git grep`. Despite this, there's no `cmd` processes (according to process explorer or `get-process`)when I run long running commands in powershell. 

@BrucePay can you explain this further? Why is cmd being used here? Is cmd being used as an interpreter or some other part of the console? Thanks!

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@mikemaccana: 

I've updated my SO answer to explain in detail how Node.js uses batch files on Windows.

At this point there is nothing to suggest that PowerShell is involved in this behavior at all.

If you're not convinced, let's continue the discussion on SO until we have clarity.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
Thanks @mklement0 that explains things. I see see that powershell is invoking cmd when calling gulp (since gulp itself is a cmd file when run on windows). 

@brucepay Is it worth filing this in https://github.com/Microsoft/console, or some other place? Is cmd.exe even maintained / updated anymore?

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body: @mikemaccana With Microsoft's new focus on command line experiences it may be worth submitting it. It certainly can't hurt.

title: Add environment variable to disable/enable 'Terminate batch job (Y/N)?' confirmation
